workflow.name: Extract business card data & generate follow-ups with Google Vision OCR & GPT-4 Mini
workflow.description:
This n8n template helps you turn business cards into qualified sales opportunities ‚Äî instantly.

No more lost leads after events or networking meetups. Just send a business card photo via Telegram, and let AI handle the rest.

The workflow extracts details (name, company, role, email, phone) using Google Vision OCR, analyzes context with OpenAI, and then generates personalized WhatsApp or email messages to help you follow up faster.

## Use Cases

Capture leads instantly from events or meetups.

Auto-analyze business card data into structured CRM entries.

Send hyper-personalized WhatsApp messages or emails within minutes.

Ideal for founders, marketers, and business development teams.

## How it Works

Trigger: Send a photo of a business card via Telegram.

Extract: Google Vision OCR reads and extracts all text from the image.

Process: The extracted text is sent to an AI agent (OpenAI GPT-4.1-mini) for:

Contact parsing (name, company, role, email, phone)

Business/industry inference

AI-generated personalized follow-up messages

Output: The system returns structured JSON containing:

Email subject & body

WhatsApp draft message

Fit score, opportunities, and next action steps

## How to Use

Import the JSON template into n8n.

Add your Telegram Bot Token to the ‚ÄúTelegram Trigger‚Äù node.

Add your Google Cloud Vision API key in the HTTP Request node.

Add your OpenAI credentials in the ‚ÄúOpenAI Chat Model‚Äù node.

(Optional) Connect the output to Google Sheets, Airtable, or your CRM.

Run the workflow ‚Äî take a photo of a business card and watch the magic happen!

## Requirements

Telegram Bot for image input

Google Vision API Key

OpenAI API Key

(Optional) Integration with CRM or WhatsApp API

## Customization Ideas

Replace Telegram with Email or WhatsApp triggers.

Push qualified leads directly into HubSpot or Notion.

Automate multi-step sequences based on AI fit scores.

workflow.name: Business Cards to Qualified Connections ‚Äî AI-Powered Follow-up Automation

parameters.text:
=Here is the raw OCR text extracted from a business card:
{{ $json.raw_text }}

Here is the caption or context message (what the user said when sending the card):
{{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.caption }}

My details (use these in the message footer or when signing off):
- Name: Aditya Malur
- Title: AI Powered Mentor & Consultant
- Email: hi@adityamalur.com
- Phone: +91 8088062928
- LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/aditya-malur/
- Calendly: https://calendly.com/aditya_malur/1-1
- Positioning: I help startups and businesses achieve product-market fit faster and create revenue efficiencies through Agentic AI Automations and GTM/Product strategies.

Tasks:
1. Extract structured fields:
   - name
   - company
   - role
   - emails (array, handle multiple)
   - phones (array, handle multiple, include country codes if visible or infer)
   - country (detected from phone, address, or domain)
   - website (if any)
2. Infer company type and industry from name/domain/web context.
3. Write a one-line internal summary: who they are, what the company does, why relevant.
4. Generate 3‚Äì5 specific automation or AI opportunities relevant to their business (short bullet points).
5. Score fit (1‚Äì10) and explain reasoning briefly.
6. Create:
   - subject: one-line personalized email subject.
   - htmlBody: short personalized HTML email:
       - Start with a natural greeting addressing the person by first name.
       - Mention the company within the first 2 sentences.
       - Reference their likely role and industry context.
       - Transition naturally into the potential benefits of AI/automation or your consulting.
       - Include warm, professional closing with your signature (details above).
   - whatsapp_draft: short conversational follow-up (<200 chars).
7. Write next_actions: 3 concrete internal steps.
8. Add opportunities_summary: one-paragraph internal note explaining why the opportunities are relevant.
9. Ensure all fields are valid JSON and match this exact schema:

{
  "name": "",
  "company": "",
  "role": "",
  "emails": [],
  "phones": [],
  "country": "",
  "website": "",
  "one_line_summary": "",
  "opportunities": ["", "", ""],
  "opportunities_summary": "",
  "fit_score": 0,
  "fit_reason": "",
  "subject": "",
  "htmlBody": "",
  "whatsapp_draft": "",
  "next_actions": ["", "", ""]
}

options.systemMessage:
You are a professional B2B Sales & Outreach assistant with real-world consulting experience. 
You must output strict JSON only ‚Äî no markdown, no text outside JSON.
Be factual, concise, structured, and persuasive.
If any field is missing, leave it as an empty string or empty array ([]).
Detect country automatically from phone codes, address, or web context.
Use the user-provided details for signing off emails and WhatsApp messages.
Always start emails with a natural greeting addressing the person by first name (Dear/Hi/Hello <First Name>) and reference the company naturally within the first 2 sentences.
Ensure the tone is warm, credible, and human ‚Äî avoid generic AI-sounding text.
Include internal analysis for opportunities, fit, and follow-up steps.
Output must strictly follow the JSON schema provided by the USER.

parameters.content:
## Business Cards to Qualified Connections (AI-Powered Follow-up Automation)

How It Flows:

You send a business card photo to your Telegram bot.

The image gets converted to Base64.

Google Vision reads the text.

AI extracts details & drafts a personalized email.

Data gets cleaned, validated, and checked.

Everything is saved to Google Sheets.

(Optional) Email copy gets sent to you.

## Telegram Trigger

What it does: Starts the workflow when someone sends a photo or message on Telegram.

Setup:

Connect your Telegram bot (you‚Äôll get a bot token from BotFather).

Choose Update Type: message.

Turn on Download: ‚úÖ (so image files are included).

Once saved, n8n gives you a webhook URL ‚Äî connect it to your Telegram bot via /setWebhook

## Convert Image to Base64

What it does: Converts the received business card image into Base64 format so the next node (Google Vision) can read it.

Setup:

No credentials needed.

Just copy the code given ‚Äî it handles conversion automatically.

## Google Vision OCR

What it does: Sends the Base64 image to Google Vision API to extract the text (names, emails, etc.).

Setup:

URL: https://vision.googleapis.com/v1/images:annotate?key=YOUR_API_KEY

Method: POST

Add your Google Vision API key.

Set Body to the JSON shown in the code (already ready for copy-paste).

Headers: Content-Type: application/json

## Extract Raw Text
What it does: Picks only the plain text result from the OCR response.

Setup:

No config needed ‚Äî just passes clean text (raw_text) to the AI Agent.

## AI Agent
What it does:
This is where the magic happens. It takes:

OCR text from the card

Caption (what you typed in Telegram)

Your personal details
and asks the AI to structure info (name, company, email, phone, etc.) and generate:

a personalized email,

a WhatsApp follow-up,

automation ideas,

and next actions.

Setup:

Add your OpenAI API key.

Choose Language Model: OpenAI Chat Model (connected below).

Paste the detailed prompt already written (don‚Äôt edit unless you know what you're doing).

## Clean AI Output
What it does:

Parses and cleans the AI JSON output.

Removes formatting or markdown if any.

Makes sure all data is in proper fields before saving or sending.

Setup:

No manual setup. Just make sure your AI Agent outputs JSON only.doing).

## Check for Email Found
What it does:
Checks if the AI extracted at least one valid email address.

Setup:

Left value: {{$json.emails[0]}}

Condition: ‚ÄúIs not empty‚Äù.

## Append Row in Sheet (Google Sheets)
What it does:
Saves all extracted info and AI-generated content (emails, phone, company, etc.) to a Google Sheet.

Setup:

Connect your Google account.

Paste your Sheet ID (YOUR_GOOGLE_SHEET_ID).

Map all columns as shown in the JSON.

Sheet name: Sheet1 (or use your sheet‚Äôs name).

## Send a Message (Gmail)
What it does:
Optionally sends you a copy of the generated email.

Setup:

Connect Gmail.

‚ÄúSend To‚Äù: your email.

Subject: {{$json['Email Subject']}}

Message: {{$json['Email Body']}}

## Created with <3 by Aditya Malur
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/aditya-malur/

user.name: Aditya Malur
user.bio: I design AI-powered automation systems that transform how businesses run sales, marketing, and operations. By connecting workflows and data intelligently, I help teams scale smarter reducing manual effort, improving decision-making, and driving predictable growth. My focus is on building lightweight, adaptive systems that make organizations more efficient and future-ready.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
